section.title: val_disabled
section.para: This rule property determines whether a rule must or must not be applied within the scope of its enclosing object. For example, a rule defined at the file level can be disabled at the unit level.
This property is provided to allow for overriding execution of rules set at higher levels, see val_validation.
In the following example, the isNotPresent rule is applied in its entirety to the first unit, but not to the second.
section.programlisting: <file id="f1"> <val:validation> <val:rule isPresent="store" /> </val:validation> <unit id="1"> <segment id="1"> <source>Choose an option in the online store:</source> <target>Escolha uma opção na loja online:</target> </segment> </unit> <unit id="2"> <val:validation> <val:rule isPresent="store" disabled="yes" /> </val:validation> <segment id="1"> <source>Choose an option in the application store:</source> <target>Escolha uma opção na application store:</target> </segment> </unit> </file> { "jliff": "2.1", "files": [ "val_validation": [ "isPresent": "store" ], "id": "f1", "subfiles": [ { "id": "1", "kind": "unit", "subunits": [ { "id": "1", "kind": "segment", "source": [ { "text": "Choose an option in the online store:" } ], "target": [ { "text": "Escolha uma opção na loja online:" } ] } ] }, { "id": "2", "kind": "unit", "subunits": [ { "id": "1", "kind": "segment", "source": [ { "text": "Choose an option in the application store:" } ], "target": [ { "text": "Escolha uma opção na application store:" } ], "val_validation": [ "isPresent": "store", "disabled": "yes" ], } ] } ] ] }
